I take the same medication that type 2 diabetes patience take for my cysts.  I was diagnosed about a year ago with polycystic ovaries.  You can do things to try to control the cysts.  Try to lose weight.  It can be hard but losing weight helps.  My doctor told me to read up on the south beach diet because many of the tips in the book will help people like me.  Do a general search on cysts you will learn a lot.  It has contributed to my infertility.  There are many things you can learn about what your body is doing currently.

I had surgery last march to get rid of the cysts.  Some people are able to take birth control to rid of the cysts.  In the case of polycistic ovaries the female body becomes full of male hormones.  THis causes the changes like the darkening of hair, male pattern baldness (on your head - I notice this in the shower), your weight gain centers around the mid section, and so much more.  Once you learn what cysts do to your body you learn how to deal with the changes they have caused.  Do you just have one cyst?  They can cause a great deal of pain with they rupture.  No one knows what causes.  Some believe it is hereditary - possibly from a mother or sister that has cysts but, again, this has not been proven.
